subtasks: Approach hay storage area.
Climb into hay storage area.
Grasp hay bails.
Lift hay bails onto cart or loading platform.
Transport hay bails to transport vehicle.
Position hay bails on transport vehicle.
Secure hay bails on transport vehicle.

tasks.task: Load hay into transport vehicle while avoiding obstacles.
subtasks: Approach hay storage area with obstacles.
Be mindful of low-hanging branches or objects.
Modify approach path to avoid collisions.
Continue loading hay while safely navigating obstacles.
Approach transport vehicle containing hay.
Open doors or gates to access loaded hay.
Reach into transport vehicle.
Grasp hay bails or bundles.
Lift hay bails or bundles from transport vehicle.
Transport hay bails or bundles to unloading area.
Arrange hay in unloading area.
Identify broken hay bails.
Approach the broken hay bails.
Remove broken hay bails from storage or transport.
Apply first aid or reinforce with twine or wire.
Rejoin the bailed hay and secure it.
Observe existing hay stack.
Add new hay bails to the stack, ensuring stability.
Check for loose or misaligned bails.
Secure stack with netting or twine to prevent collapse.
Tidy up surrounding area, removing debris or loose hay.

tasks.task: Drive a tractor to transport hay.
subtasks: Sit in tractor seat.
Adjust seat and mirrors for visibility.
Start tractor engine.
Select appropriate gear for route.
Navigating roads to hay storage or transport location.
Park tractor at appropriate location.

tasks.task: Refuel tractor during or after operation.
subtasks: Approach fueling area.
Open fuel tank cap or port.
Connect fuel nozzle to tractor.
Operate fuel valve to fill tank.
Ensure proper air bubble expulsion.
Shut off fuel, disconnect nozzle.
Secure fuel cap.
Drive tractor with attached spreader.
Position self over field or designated application area.
Engage spreader mechanism.
Overlap passes to cover entire field uniformly.
Adjust spreader settings for optimal distribution.

tasks.task: Conduct a thorough inspection of fields before planting.
subtasks: Walk through fields to assess ground conditions.
Note areas with poor drainage, weeds, or previous crop residue.
Identify potential pest or disease hotspots.
Check irrigation systems for functionality.
Review soil reports for nutrient levels.

tasks.task: Plant crops using a tractor-drawn planter.
subtasks: Attach seed box to planter.
Fill seed box with appropriate seeds.
Adjust row spacing and seeding depth.
Drive tractor through field at optimal speed.
Monitor planter performance and make adjustments.
Protect seedlings from birds or other pests.

tasks.task: Harvest crops using a combine harvester.
subtasks: Prepare combine for harvest by attaching appropriate attachments.
Drive combine through the fields.
Monitor grain quality and adjust combine settings as needed.
Load harvested grain into trucks or bins.
Perform maintenance checks and clean combine after harvest.

tasks.task: Apply pesticides or herbicides to crops.
subtasks: Drive tractor with spray boom attached.
Mix pesticides or herbicides in tank.
Calibration of nozzles for proper spray coverage.
Apply chemicals according to labeled rates and patterns.
Wear protective gear and ensure safety while spraying.

tasks.task: Operate a baler to harvest hay.
subtasks: Attach baling twine or net wrap.
Load bales from the field onto the baler.
Compress hay into bales and secure them.
Remove bales from the baler and transport them.

tasks.task: Properly stack hay in a barn or silo.
subtasks: Clean stacking area.
Use cranes or fork-lifts for stacking large bales.
Arrange bales in layers, stagger joints for stability.
Seal edges with tarps or plastic to prevent spoilage.
Inspect stacks for loose or shifting bales.
Inspect all moving parts for wear.
Lubricate necessary components.
Check and replace worn-out belts or hoses.
Clean machinery to prevent dust buildup and overheating.
Modify approach path to avoid collisions.
